subject_event_coorganizer_added: You've been added as a coorganizer to {{ eventName }}!
Here's some feedback from the Webmaker c: Here's some feedback from the Webmaker community member who reviewed your application:
b_a_d_1: Thanks for applying for the {{ badgeName }} badge. Unfortunately, your application has not been approved at this time.
b_a_d_2: Hope that's helpful! Please review the feedback and apply for the badge again anytime you're ready.
e_m_c_1: You've been selected to be a mentor at an upcoming event called {{ eventName }}.
e_m_c_2: To confirm your attendance as a mentor, click here.
e_m_c_2_b: To confirm your attendance as a mentor, click here to sign up for an account and confirm that you're coming.
e_m_c_3: Please note that {{ organizerUsername }} (the organizer of the event) will know your email address.
e_m_c_4: To decline, click here. (You may also want to let the organizer know you won't be coming.)
e_c_a_1: You've been selected to be a co-organizer at an upcoming event called {{ eventName }}. That means you will be able to edit the event by updating the description, adding mentors, and more.
e_c_a_2: To edit this event, click here. You can also remove yourself as a coorganizer if you'd like.
e_c_1: I'm excited to hear you're throwing an event! To help you make it great, we've compiled some tips and tricks in our resources section. You can learn how to organize your event, find teaching resources, get press coverage, work with local partners, gather feedback, and more. You can also order Webmaker gear like lanyards and stickers to hand out to your participants.
e_c_2: Remember to document everything with photos, videos, quotes and whatever else might be helpful. Share the details of your party on Twitter, Facebook and Flickr with the #makerparty hashtag. We will be watching.
e_c_3: If you have any questions, don't hesitate to contact me. I'm here to help!
r_u_a_e_1: This is a reminder that you have an upcoming event.
